sentence.Network_en: He shook as with a palsy.

sentence.Network_en: The man had palsy in his arm.
His body shook with a palsy of fright.
sentence.Network_cn: 他全身发抖,真是吓瘫了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French paralisie, from an alteration of Latin paralysis (see paralysis)

entry.def: Palsy is a loss of feeling in part of your body.

means.word_mean: 1. loss of the ability to move a body part
2. a condition marked by uncontrollable tremor
